title: Was Freddie Mercury high on cocaine during his Live Aid performance? - Quora

response.answer_text: The biography of Jim Hutton, Freddie’s partner details that Freddie enjoyed cocaine and this was always his recreational drug of choice. The book also has details of the Live Aid gig, which Jim watched off stage. There is no mention of coke being used directly before this or any gig. Any 80s gathering of pop stars probably included recreational drugs after the performance. I’m not sure many artists would want to perform to the 120,000 estimated people in the stadium and millions watching live, while coked up.

It’s not because live aid’s perf was amazing that Freddie was high on coke. He was an excellent artist and VERY professional. He’s never beeen high in any gigs. Yes 1 or 2 times he was a little bit drunk but it was still a perfect show. Freddie did enjoy coke but recreationally. It enabled him to be less shy when there were a lot of strangers around him. But he’d never let any substances ( coke/alcohol…) being in control of him. He was Always in control of everything. Of course there’re some very very funny stories of him drunk, but I mean who’s never been drunk ? He wasn’t like some superstars completely destroyed by all sort of things. And that’s also why he was the greatest, always professional and serious. He knew when it was time to work and when it was time to party.
